result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant phoned and said that he was in a serious car accident, has left many messages with his attorney over the the last week and a half, but heard nothing back from him. He said he is frustrated that he cannot reach him, and cannot make it to court in person today. He was given instructions to appear by zoom for this afternoon's hearing.
of Judge (Defendant's)              (09/19 - approved bv the court)

10:36 AM Defendant DERRICK J CHURCH in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared by video for DERRICK J CHURCH. Atty Kapelis states defendant will waive his right to prelim. Atty Kapelis states he will be requesting a judicial substitution. Defendant states he does not want a judicial substitution. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Court scheduled arraignment September 20, 2022 at 1:00 PM.  ADA McElroy states he filed the information with the court.

Court Adjourned at 10:39 AM.
Arraignment scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
(Atty Michael Kapelis)

Defendant left a voicemail saying he did not have a ride to court and requesting to reschedule today's hearing. Rescheduled hearing to August 2, 2022 and left a return voicemail on 07/14/2022, informing the defendant of the new date, and advising that if he did not have an attorney before the hearing, he would need to be here and appear in person, no more reschedules.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:41 AM Defendant DERRICK J CHURCH appeared in court, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def qualifies for the public defender but is not sure who will be appointed. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel/Prelim March 23, 2022 at 11:15 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:43 AM.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
